intro: Hebe stenophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leaved hebe, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It is a member of the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its slender, upright growth habit. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that range in color from blue to purple, typically blooming in spring. Its leaves are narrow and often have a silvery or grayish underside, giving it a distinctive appearance. Hebe stenophylla is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
